evidence.pdf_reference: on a glass reactor with an area of 4.2 cm 2 .A 300 W Xenon arc lamp was used as the light source for the photocatalytic reaction.The volume of the reaction system was about 230 mL.The reaction setup was vacuum-treated several times, and then high-purity CO 2 gas was introduced into the reaction to achieve ambient pressure.Deionized water (0.4 mL) was injected into the reaction system as reducing reagent.During the irradiation, about 1 mL of gas was taken from the reaction cell at given intervals for

For the dispersion of RuO 2 particles as a cocatalyst on Zn 2 GeO 4 , 0.25 g Zn 2 GeO 4 photocatalyst powder was impregnated with ruthenium carbonyl complex, Ru 3 (CO) 12 (Aldrich Chemical Co., 99 pure), in THF and oxidized at 350 C in air for 4 h to convert the Ru complex species to RuO 2 particles.RuO 2 was loaded at the rate of 1 (mass fraction) for these as-prepared Zn 2 GeO 4 . In the photocatalytic reduction of CO 2 , Zn 2 GeO 4 powder (0.1 g) was uniformly dispersed on a glass reactor with an area

phase route with 0 g CTAB (a), with 0.1 g CTAB (b) and SSR-Zn 2 GeO 4 (c) Fig. 2 TEM images of Zn 2 GeO 4 obtained by solution phase route with 0.1 g CTAB (a), (b), HRTEM image of crystal lattice (c), (d) and selected area electron diffraction (SAED) patterns (inset of c) Fig. 5 CH 4 generation over Zn 2 GeO 4 obtained by solution phase route with 0.1 g CTAB (a), with 0 g CTAB (b) and SSR-Zn 2 GeO 4 (c)

the above-mentioned Zn 2 GeO 4 samples as photocatalysts.The mechanism of photoreduction of CO 2 into CH 4 can be described as follows: under UV-vis light irradiation, the photogenerated hole on the valence band top (potential: 2.86 V vs NHE) 22 of Zn 2 GeO 4 can lead to oxidation of water to produce hydrogen ions via H 2 O12O 2 2H 2e -(E o redox 0.82 V vs NHE), 12 and the photogenerated electron on the conduction band bottom (potential: -0.29 V vs NHE) of Zn 2 GeO 4 can drive the reduction of CO 2 into CH

the reduction of CO 2 into CH 4 via CO 2 8e -8H CH 4 H 2 O (E o redox -0.24V vs NHE) 23.From Fig. 5, it is obvious that Zn 2 GeO 4 nanorods obtained by adding 0.1 g CTAB (7.6210 -6 h -1 CH 4 ) exhibit higher activity than Zn 2 GeO 4 nanorods obtained without adding CTAB (5.3310 -6 h -1 CH 4 ) and SSR-Zn 2 GeO 4 (2.85 10 -6 h -1 CH 4 ).The Zn 2 GeO 4 nanorods exhibit the better photoreduction performance, which is attributed to the higher specific surface area (47.62 m 2 g) than those of Zn 2 GeO 4 (23.16m

The generation condition of the extraction is given: If Light_source is Solar or Solar Simulator, Lamp is always Solar Simulator.

Please generating restrictively follow the format, and must start the generation as the format. Do not generate anything else.

Zn 2 GeO 4 nanorods were prepared by a surfactant-assisted solution phase route.The as-prepared products were characterized by X-ray powder diffraction (XRD), scanning electron microscopy (SEM), high-resolution transmission electron microscopy (HRTEM), inductively coupled plasma atomic emission spectrometer (ICP-AES), UV-vis diffuse reflection spectroscopy and photoluminescence (PL) spectroscopy.The possible formation mechanism of Zn 2 GeO 4 nanorods was discussed.It was supposed that the CTA cations
